text: Miloš Ćojbašić (, born August 11, 2000) is a Serbian professional basketball player, currently playing for Cherno More Ticha in Varna of the Bulgarian League. == Early career == Ćojbašić started playing basketball for KK Borča in Belgrade. In 2016, he joined KK Zemun. In summer 2017, he became a member of Crvena zvezda youth system. With Crvena Zvezda he was 2 time Champion in Serbian championship league. Ćojbašić also won the second place at the 2017–18 Junior ABA League season with the Crvena Zvezda. Over six tournament games, he averaged 5.2 points and 1.8 rebounds per game. He also won the second place at the 2018–19 Junior ABA League season with the Crvena Zvezda. == Professional career == In January 2018, Ćojbašić signed his first professional contract with Crvena zvezda and he played for Crvena zvezda youth team. In August 2018, he was loaned out to Žarkovo of the Second League of Serbia. In August 2019, he was added to Sloga of the Second League of Serbia. After 3 months, as per the advice of his manager, Milos signed a contract with the Bulgarian club Tundja Yambol. He stayed a few months in Yambol and have transferred to Cherno More Ticha Varna. In the Bulgarian championship, he has great statistics and he shows full potential in senior basketball. == References == == External links == * Profile at eurobasket.com * Profile at euroleague.net * Profile at realgm.com * Profile at ABA League * Profile at NBL Bulgaria League Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:Basketball League of Serbia players Category:BC Yambol players Category:KK Crvena zvezda youth players Category:KK Sloga players Category:KK Žarkovo players Category:People from Belgrade Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Serbian expatriate basketball people in Bulgaria Category:Serbian men's basketball players Category:Power forwards (basketball)
title: Miloš Ćojbašić
